definition: prevailing among and common to the general public, a fact about the whole, as opposed to particular, command as a general
details:
adjective
- prevailing among and common to the general public
= example: prevailing among and common to the general public
- of worldwide scope or applicability
= synonyms: cosmopolitan, ecumenical, oecumenical, universal, worldwide, world-wide
- not specialized or limited to one class of things
= example: not specialized or limited to one class of things
- applying to all or most members of a category or group
= example: applying to all or most members of a category or group
- affecting the entire body
= example: affecting the entire body
- somewhat indefinite
= example: somewhat indefinite
noun
- a fact about the whole, as opposed to particular
= example: a fact about the whole, as opposed to particular
- a general officer of the highest rank
= synonyms: full general
- the head of a religious order or congregation
= synonyms: superior general
verb
- command as a general
= example: command as a general
